clinical_study.brief_title: Acute and Long-term Impact of Cancer Treatment on Head and Neck Cancer Patients: FIT4TREATMENT
clinical_study.official_title: Acute and Long-term Impact of Cancer Treatment on Quality-of-life, Physical and Cognitive Function of Head and Neck Cancer Patients

lead_sponsor.agency: Associacao de Investigacao de Cuidados de Suporte em Oncologia

collaborator.agency: Centro Hospitalar de Vila Nova de Gaia/Espinho, E.P.E.

clinical_study.source: Associacao de Investigacao de Cuidados de Suporte em Oncologia

brief_summary.textblock: Head and Neck Squamous Cell Carcinoma (HNSCC) is the 6th most common cancer. Most cases are diagnosed in locally advanced stages, with treatment involving multimodal approach with combinations of radiotherapy, surgery and chemotherapy. The aggressive nature of HNSCCs and treatment modalities are associated with important acute and late toxicities that often promote temporary or definitive treatment interruption and may compromised the capability to tolerate subsequent treatments. Thus, the aim of this study is to analyze the acute and long-term impact of cancer treatment on quality of life, physical and cognitive function of HNSCC patients diagnosed with a locally advanced disease.

detailed_description.textblock: Potential cases will be identified at the multidisciplinary head and neck group meeting. If the case meets eligibility an informed consent will be presented to the patient. Interested participants will be scheduled for baseline assessment before the beginning of treatment (M0). At the end of CRT patients will be submitted to a second assessment (M1). Follow-up assessments will occur 16th to 18th weeks after the treatment is completed (M2). Patients proposed to surgery or induction chemotherapy will also be submitted to an additional assessment before the beginning of CRT (Mc / Mic).

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change of global quality of life score from baseline to the end of treatment
primary_outcome.description: Global quality of life score evaluated by EORTC QLQ-C30 questionnaire (range in score from 0 to 100, high score represents a high level of functioning)

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change of global quality of life score from baseline to 4 months after the treatment is completed
primary_outcome.description: Global quality of life score evaluated by EORTC QLQ-C30 questionnaire (range in score from 0 to 100, high score represents a high level of functioning)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change of fatigue score from baseline to the end of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Fatigue score evaluated by EORTC QLQ-C30 questionnaire (range in score from 0 to 100, high score represents high level of symptomatology / problems)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change of fatigue score from baseline to 4 months after the treatment is completed
secondary_outcome.description: Fatigue score evaluated by EORTC QLQ-C30 questionnaire (range in score from 0 to 100, high score represents high level of symptomatology / problems)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change of body mass index from baseline to the end of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Social functioning score evaluated by EORTC QLQ-C30 questionnaire (range in score from 0 to 100, high score represents a high level of functioning)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change of body mass index from baseline to 4 months after the treatment is completed
secondary_outcome.description: Social functioning score evaluated by EORTC QLQ-C30 questionnaire (range in score from 0 to 100, high score represents a high level of functioning)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change of body mass index from baseline to the end of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Body mass index, evaluated by bioelectrical impedance (BMI kg/m^2).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change of body mass index from baseline to 4 months after the treatment is completed
secondary_outcome.description: Body mass index, evaluated by bioelectrical impedance (BMI kg/m^2).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change of MoCA score from baseline to the end of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluated by the Montreal Cognitive Assessment and the Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy-Cognitive (MoCA score range between 0 and 30, a score of 26 or over is considered to be normal).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change of MoCA score from baseline to 4 months after the treatment is completed
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluated by the Montreal Cognitive Assessment and the Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy-Cognitive (MoCA score range between 0 and 30, a score of 26 or over is considered to be normal).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change of EAT-10 score from baseline to the end of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Severity of dysphagia assessed by Eating Assessment Tool (EAT-10 total score ranges from 0 to 40, with a score ≥ 3 indicative of dysphagia)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change of EAT-10 score from baseline to 4 months after the treatment is completed
secondary_outcome.description: Severity of dysphagia assessed by Eating Assessment Tool (EAT-10 total score ranges from 0 to 40, with a score ≥ 3 indicative of dysphagia)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change of FOIS score from baseline to the end of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Severity of dysphagia assessed by Functional Oral Intake Scale (FOIS ranges from 1 to 7)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change of FOIS score from baseline to 4 months after the treatment is completed
secondary_outcome.description: Severity of dysphagia assessed by Functional Oral Intake Scale (FOIS ranges from 1 to 7)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change of PG-SGA total score from baseline to the end of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluated by the Patient-Generated Subjective Global Assessment (PG-SGA range from 0-35 with a higher score reflecting a greater risk of malnutrition).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change of PG-SGA total score from baseline to 4 months after the treatment is completed
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluated by the Patient-Generated Subjective Global Assessment (PG-SGA range from 0-35 with a higher score reflecting a greater risk of malnutrition).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change of muscle strength from baseline to the end of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Measured with manual dynamometers (Kgf).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change of muscle strength from baseline to 4 months after the treatment is completed
secondary_outcome.description: Measured with manual dynamometers (Kgf).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change of muscle strength from baseline to the end of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Measured with manual dynamometers (Kgf).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change of muscle strength score from baseline to 4 months after the treatment is completed
secondary_outcome.description: Measured with manual dynamometers (Kgf).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change of repetitions from baseline to the end of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Sit-to-stand test during 30 seconds

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change of repetitions from baseline to 4 months after the treatment is completed
secondary_outcome.description: Sit-to-stand test during 30 seconds

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change of distance from baseline to the end of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: 6 minutes walking test (meters).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change of distance from baseline to 4 months after the treatment is completed
secondary_outcome.description: 6 minutes walking test (meters)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 years follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: Defined as the time from the beginning of treatment to the date of first progression or death (whichever occurs first) and will be censored at last follow-up date if the patient does not have the event. A progression (local, regional or distant) will be assumed accordingly to the imaging evaluation and/or histopathologic confirmation.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 years follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: Defined as the time from the beginning of treatment to the date of death from any cause, for patients who do not die, it will be censored at their last follow-up date.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 years follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: Defined as the proportion of patients that complete the first cycle of the first line palliative chemotherapy after a documented progression (considering all patients with a formal indication).

study_pop.textblock: Eligible patients had to have more than 18 years, diagnosed with stage III to IVB HNSCC and proposed for primary treatment with curative intent - surgery or induction chemotherapy before chemoradiotherapy (CRT) or CRT alone. Exclusion criteria was: 1) synchronous tumors or other comorbidities with associated uncontrolled symptoms; 2) inability to provide informed consent; 3) expected inability to fulfil the propose schedule and follow-up.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients older than 18 years.
- Diagnosis of locally advanced head and neck cancer (oral cavity, oropharynx, hypopharynx, larynx), stage III-IVB.
- Proposed for primary treatment with curative intent - surgery or induction chemotherapy before chemoradiotherapy (CRT) or CRT alone.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Synchronous tumors or other comorbidities with associated uncontrolled symptoms.
- Inability to provide informed consent.
- Expected inability to fulfil the propose schedule and follow-up.
